dmca.title: [Fwd: [ABUSE] RE: Complaint re Hosted Domain Name <smsoops.com>]
dmca.body:
Please note that the web site referenced in your Trademark complaint does
not reside within our network as of 11:28:45 a.m. (GMT-6) on January 10,
2006.
 
Legal Response Team
The Planet 

-----Original Message-----
From: The Planet Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Tuesday, January 10, 2006 9:12 AM
To: GStanton@perkinscoie.com; copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] RE: Complaint re Hosted Domain Name <smsoops.com>]

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Your email is being forwarded on to our Copyright counsel for review, at the
address of copyright@theplanet.com.


- -------- Original Message --------
Subject: [ABUSE] RE: Complaint re Hosted Domain Name <smsoops.com>
Date: Mon, 9 Jan 2006 15:44:46 -0800
From: Stanton, Grace Han  (Perkins Coie) <GStanton@perkinscoie.com>
To: <abuse@theplanet.com>


Dear Sir or Madam,        


Having received no response to our original inquiry email below, I am
following up with you.  I would appreciate your comments to our request at
your earliest convenience.  Thank you.

Regards,
Grace Han Stanton
Perkins Coie LLP
1201 Third Avenue, Suite 4000
Seattle, WA  98101
ph: (206) 359-6483
fax: (206) 359-7483
www.perkinscoie.com



>  -----Original Message-----
> From:         Stanton, Grace Han  (Perkins Coie) 

> Sent:        Friday, December 30, 2005 1:52 PM
> To:        'abuse@theplanet.com'
> Subject:        Complaint re Hosted Domain Name <smsoops.com>

>

> Re:         Hosted Domain Name <smsoops.com>
>         Our Ref.: 31902-7000.0.CX009
> Dear Sir or Madam,

> We represent Chancery Software, Inc. in connection with their 
> trademark and copyright matters and are writing about the domain name 
> <smsoops.com> (the "URL"), the web site for which (the "Site") we 
> believe is hosted by your company. Pursuant to the Acceptable User 
> Policy posted on ThePlanet.com, we write concerning trademark and 
> copyright infringement of Chancery Software's proprietary rights on 
> the Site.
> According to enom.com, the URL reportedly redirects to IP address 
> 70.84.252.218, which according to NetworkSolutions' Who-is record is 
> hosted by ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. Please advise us if 
> this information is not correct.
> Chancery Software is the owner of the trademarks SMS, Design of a 
> Graduation Cap and CHANCERY STUDENT MANAGEMENT SOLUTION, all which are 
> being used on the Site without Chancery Software's permission. The SMS 
> mark is the subject of US federal trademark Registration No. 2872872 
> for the mark CHANCERY SMS covering a broad range of class 9 education 
> software and class 42 computer and technical support services.
> Chancery Software is also the owner of the mark CHANCERY STUDENT 
> MANAGEMENT SOLUTIONS, also the subject of US federal Registration Nos.
> 2840801 and 2845468. All of these marks, including the marks SMS and 
> Design of a Graduation Cap are prominently featured on my client's web 
> site and are protected under US trademark and copyright laws. Please 
> see www.chancery.com and http://www.chancery.com/prod_sms.html.
> Chancery Software is an award-winning provider of education-related 
> software and its Chancery SMS product is very well known in the 
> education industry. While we understand that there is a narrow defense 
> to trademark infringement under the First Amendment recognizing free 
> speech, the Site goes beyond this defense when it uses Chancery 
> Software's distinctive logos and stylized marks without its 
> permission. Clearly, this company has encountered other copyright 
> infringement issues as self-reported on the Site. See 
> http://www.smsoops.com/cartoons/index.htm.

> Pursuant to your authority under the Acceptable User Policy, we 
> request that you suspend hosting for this web site any associated 
> email addresses based on a clear infringement of Chancery Software's 
> trademark rights and copyright.
> We also think it is worth noting that it appears that the owner of the 
> URL extensively uses the Snoopy character, depictions and the Snoopy 
> theme song on the Site, presumably without permission from the 
> appropriate owner. Please see www.smsoops.com.
> Please do not hesitate to let us know if you have any questions.
> Otherwise, we look forward to your response to our inquiry and 
> request. Thank you for your time and consideration.
> Sincerely,

> Grace Han Stanton

> Perkins Coie LLP

> 1201 Third Avenue, Suite 4000

> Seattle, WA 98101

> ph: (206) 359-6483

> fax: (206) 359-7483

> www.perkinscoie.com

>

>



NOTICE: This communication may contain privileged or other confidential
information. If you have received it in error, please advise the sender by
reply email and immediately delete the message and any attachments without
copying or disclosing the contents. Thank you.

- --
Thanks,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/aup.html
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
